intro: Dispermotheca viscosa, commonly known as the sticky dispermotheca, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which contribute to its sticky texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release the seeds, a feature typical of the genus Dispermotheca.
